qas.question: When did the first World War begin?
Who defeated the Central Powers led by the German Empire Austro-Hungarian Empire and the Ottoman Empire??
What were the Allied powers referred to before 1917?
How many Empires did the war cause destruction to?

context: The First World War began in <a0_0>1914<a0_0/> and lasted to the final Armistice in 1918. The Allied Powers, led by the <a1_0>British Empire, France, Russia<a1_0/> until March 1918, <a2_0>Japan and the United States<a2_0/> after 1917, defeated the Central Powers, led by the German Empire, Austro-Hungarian Empire and the Ottoman Empire. The war caused the disintegration of <a4_0>four empires<a4_0/>—the Austro-Hungarian, German, Ottoman, and Russian ones—as well as radical change in the European and West Asian maps. The Allied powers before 1917 are referred to as the <a3_0>Triple Entente<a3_0/>, and the Central Powers are referred to as the Triple Alliance.
